meanings.definition: The property or phenomenon of changing resistance in a material in response to an applied magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The magnetoresistances of the metal wire increased when a magnet was brought close.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study magnetoresistances to understand how materials react to magnets.
meanings.sent3: The magnetoresistances of the circuit were so high that even the magnetic field couldn't get through!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a maze of thoughts, each one a different magnetoresistance to progress.
meanings.sent5: The magnetoresistances of the material were like tiny dancers swaying to the magnetic tune.

meanings.definition: The measurement of the change in resistance in a material due to the presence of a magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The device accurately recorded the magnetoresistances of the metal strip.
meanings.sent2: Engineers use magnetoresistances to design sensors for various applications.
meanings.sent3: The magnetoresistances on the screen showed a funny pattern when the magnet moved.
meanings.sent4: In the classroom, the students' attention was a magnetoresistance to the teacher's voice.
meanings.sent5: The magnetoresistances measured in the experiment were as clear as day, confirming the theory.
